version_description:
- Bugfixes
- Support for the Carista Bluetooth LE Adapter
- Minimum and maximum values for the gauges in the dashboard can now be configured to your liking
- Color indication in the dashboard gauges for specific value ranges

- Minor improvements
- Bugfixes

This update contains bugfixes and improvements.

If you BimmerLink, I would be pleased if you leave a rating and review in the App Store.
Fixed WLAN connection issues

- Improved exhaust flap control
- Bugfixes
- Bugfixes
- Bugfixes

- Added missing sensor values
- Fixed problem reading sensor values for some diesel engines

- iPhone X optimization
- Add support for Vgate iCar Pro Bluetooth 4.0 adapter
- Bug fixes

- Support for Kiwi 3 adapter
- Support for Veepeak OBDCheck Bluetooth 4.0 adapter
- Support for UniCarScan adapter
- Bug fixes
- English translations for sensor values and error descriptions

- DPF values and regeneration request
- Battery values and battery replacement registration
- iPad support
- Bug fixes and stability improvements
- Bug fixes

- OBDLink MX+ adapter support
- DPF functions for additional engines
- Battery registration for cars with B48/B58 engine
- User defined sensor value units
- Improved sensor value reading speed
- Sensor value log to CSV file
- Bug fixes and stability improvements

- The dashboard now allows you to select yourself, how many gauges are displayed per page
- Fixed a bug that caused slow sensor value and dashboard refresh rates
- Additional bug fixes and stability improvements
- Fix for connection problem with WiFi adapters

- Support for E Series cars built in 2008 or later
- Improved diagnostics including error details
- Bug fixes and stability improvements
- Fehlerbehebungen

- ENET cable support
- Bug fixes and stability improvements
- Bug fixes

- MHD ENET adapter support
- Bug fixes and stability improvements

- Additional sensor values
- Active Sound Design control for cars equipped with a RAM control unit
- Improved exhaust flap remote control
- Bug fixes and stability improvements

New: Many additional sensor values.
New: Improved battery registration.
Fixed: Connection problem with OBDLink CX adapter.

New: Reset the service display in your car after carrying out maintenance work like a brake pad replacement or an engine oil change.
New: The offline mode allows you to configure the dashboard without having to connect to the vehicle.
New: You can now select individual control units for reading out error codes.
New: The boost pressure is now displayed as a relative value.

New: Japanese language support
Fixed: Missing service entries
